results.title: Weight training for everybody
results.creator_credit: Universal Education and Visual Arts and Henri Bagdadi
results.brief_description: Shows a weight-training class, which includes both men and women ranging in age from 12 to 40. The instructor emphasises the need for adequate warm-up exercises such as running in place, jumping jacks, and push-ups. After each exercise is performed, animation shows the location and movement of the muscles involved and the use of those muscles is related to everyday activity.

results.title: Weight and circuit training (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram, Bruce Moir, Brian Hannant and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode no. 3 of Series “Conditioning for Sport”
Describes many specific exercises and training and condition techniques necessary for those interested in weight training. Weight training is a proven method for athletes to develop strength, power and muscular endurance, so it differs from weight lifting which emphasises strength and firm body building.

results.title: Weighing the choices: positive approaches to nutrition (TEFC
results.brief_description: This film provides practical choices for meals. It does not suggest totally eliminating certain foods from the diet, but rather consciously selecting some things more often than others in order to be healthier. There is an added benefit of weight control for people who maintain a healthy diet

results.title: Weekly review: new settlers
results.creator_credit: Stanhope Andrews, New Zealand National Film Unit, Cedric Herbert and Oxley Hughan
results.brief_description: Migrant assimilation in New Zealand. Shows the arrival of 800 displaced persons from Europe (post WWII) and subsequent activities at the reception centre at Pahiatua. Illustrates how New Zealand provides for the establishment and welfare of migrants and how these new arrivals are accustoming themselves to New Zealand conditions and way of life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanhope Andrews, New Zealand National Film Unit, Cedric Herbert and Oxley Hughan

results.title: Weekly review. Ep. 382. This is the weather office
results.creator_credit: Stanhope Andrews, New Zealand National Film Unit and J.M.D. Hardwick
results.brief_description: The work of the weather office of New Zealand where, with the assistance of 120 reporting stations in New Zealand and on surrounding islands and reports from ships at sea, meteorological information is collated and from it the weather forecast is given.

results.title: Weekly review. 187th week. The Pilchard fishermen
results.brief_description: The pilchard fishermen in New Zealand’s Marlborough Sound haul their nets by night. At dawn carrier pigeons fly from the boats to the canning factory with reports of the size of the catch, so that when the boats come in all is ready for processing the fish.
results.description: The pilchard fishermen in New Zealand’s Marlborough Sound haul their nets by night. At dawn carrier pigeons fly from the boats to the canning factory with reports of the size of the catch, so that when the boats come in all is ready for processing the fish.
